channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-4118] ComparisonFailure in 'testSysinfo(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.SysinfoTest)' on Derby 10.5 / Linux
item.description:
See e.g.

http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/10.5Branch/jvm1.6/testing/testlog/lin/757918-suitesAll_diff.txt

1) testSysinfo(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.SysinfoTest)junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<...nformation --------
[]--------------------...> but was:<...nformation --------
[Unable to analyze class path: access denied (java.util.PropertyPermission java.class.path read)
]--------------------...>
at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.SysinfoTest.testSysinfo(SysinfoTest.java:214)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)

at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is also seen in our 10.5.1.0 release testing:

http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/10.5.1.0_RC/jvm1.6-64/testing/testlog/lin/757599-suitesAll_diff.txt
http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/10.5.1.0_RC/jvm1.6/testing/testlog/lin/757599-suitesAll_diff.txt
http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/10.5.1.0_RC/jvm1.5/testing/testlog/lin/757599-suitesAll_diff.txt
http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/10.5.1.0_RC/jvm1.4/testing/testlog/lin/757599-suitesAll_diff.txt

I was able to reproduce this behaviour also on trunk:

The following classpath was ok:
CLASSPATH=derby.jar:derbyclient.jar:derbytools.jar:derbynet.jar:........

while this one failed the same way:
CLASSPATH=derbyclient.jar:derby.jar:derbytools.jar:derbynet.jar:........

The problem seems to be derbyclient.jar coming before derby.jar.

I think derbyclient.jar needs permission
permission java.util.PropertyPermission "java.class.path", "read";
in derby_tests.policy.
Kathey's guess was close, but SysinfoTest has its own policy file, so the extra permission must go into SysinfoTest.policy instead of derby_tests.policy. See attached patch.

Committed to trunk with revision 765955.
Committed to 10.5 with revision 765956.
